snippet: A constitutional amendment would only make it easier for legislators to continue to draw district maps that help no one but the incumbents.
abstract: Editorial asserts constitutional amendment proposed by New York Gov Andrew Cuomo intended to reform state's flawed district map will in fact make matters worse and increase partisan gridlock; warns amendment will make it easier for New York legislators to continue to draw district maps that keep incumbents in office, and is mainly a way to maintain status quo.
lead_paragraph: A constitutional amendment would only make it easier for legislators to continue to draw district maps that help no one but the incumbents.
